title: Associated prime
summary: In abstract algebra, an associated prime of a module M over a ring R is a type of prime ideal of R that arises as an annihilator of a (prime) submodule of M.  The set of associated primes is usually denoted by Ass R ‚Å° ( M ) , {\displaystyle \operatorname {Ass} _{R}(M),} and sometimes called the assassin or assassinator of M (word play between the notation and the fact that an  associated prime is an annihilator).[1]
